form.label: Multiple inputs

div.h1: Simple XML - Form search with multiple inputs
div.p: This form search shows how to provide multiple inputs to a form. It illustrates a pre-populated text box, a filtered text box, and a time picker.
The <searchTemplate> specifies the search. Because the form uses a time picker, it does not specify the time range.

div.pre: <searchTemplate> index=_internal source=*metrics.log group="per_sourcetype_thruput" series=$series$ $otherFilter$ | fields eps, kb, kbps </searchTemplate>

div.p: The first text box specifies series for the token, "splunkd" for the initial value, and appends '*' to each entry:
The second text box specifies otherFilter for the token, "eps>" for the filter, and appends "eps > -1" if no value is specified:

div.pre: <input type="text" token="otherFilter"> <label>events per second greater than:</label> <prefix>eps></prefix> <default>-1</default> <seed>0</seed> </input>

div.p: The form uses the default Splunk time picker:
